sentences.sContent: If we put out, say, twenty chairs, would that be enough?
sentences.sCn: 如果我们搬出去比方说20把椅子，够不够?

sentences.sContent: Let’s say your plan fails, then what?
sentences.sCn: 假设你的计划失败，那怎么办？

sentences.sContent: Let's take any writer, say (= for example) Dickens…
sentences.sCn: 我们随便举一个作家为例，比如说狄更斯…

sentences.sContent: ...I remember my aunt Mary used to say if you swallow a cherrystone...
...almost three in five people say they try to limit their usage of paper—including facial tissue and kitchen roll―to save money...
...so I was able to say to myself...
...this inability to say "no" may be hurting women's heath as well as their career...
...Women struggle to say no in the workplace for similar reasons...
...To say I had lost the thread is putting it mildly...
...What does the speaker say will happen to people who lack sleep...
...What does the man say about himself...
...So say good night sooner and it may help you stay active and vital to a ripe old age...
...It is not convincing if you say you have chosen the subject because you enjoy it...

synos.tran: 讲；说明；例如；声称；假设；指明

phrases.pCn: 为自己找借口，为自己辩护
vt. 同意（允诺，承认）；说对

words.tran: 说（say的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: used when suggesting or supposing that something might happen or be true
